description: Lilly Ledbetter, a supervisor at a Goodyear tire plant in Alabama, discovered she was receiving less pay than men who worked the same position. Her case led to a monumental law on pay equity.
title: Lilly Ledbetter, the activist who inspired fair pay act, dies at 86

description: Both Republicans and Democrats are trying to marshal Native American voters in Arizona, which could prove decisive to winning the key state.
title: Native Voters could swing Arizona. Both parties want their votes.

description: A 10-person cohort met to discuss NPR's three-week run of coverage from the day of the Biden-Trump debate until the day President Biden withdrew from the 2024 presidential race.
title: August 2024 Monthly Content Review Memo

description: Ckunsa, an indigenous language in Chile, was declared dead 70 years ago. But groups in northern Chile are successfuly reviving the language and teaching it to a new generation.
title: In Chile a language on the verge of extinction, stirs into life

description: Asian Americans are the fastest growing-voting group in the country. That means parties are courting them in tight races in states like Pennsylvania.
title: In an election race this close, Asian American voters have become a force

description: The award is shared by Daron Acemoglu and Simon Johnson of MIT and James Robinson of the University of Chicago for their research on the institutional roots of national wealth and poverty. They will split the prize money of 11 million Swedish krona or about $1.058 million.
title: Nobel Prize goes to 3 economists who study the wealth and poverty of nations

description: NPR is celebrating Indigenous Peoples' Day by acknowledging Indigenous people's accomplishments and delving into their culture and the issues they face with stories from our network.
title: Highlighting Indigenous voices across NPR’s network

description: China deployed ships and warplanes in large-scale military exercises surrounding Taiwan Monday, simulating the sealing off of ports in a move that underscores the tense situation in the Taiwan Strait.
title: China holds large military exercises surrounding Taiwan to warn against independence

description: Over 4,500 square miles of ocean will be protected off the California coast. It will also be managed in partnership with the indigenous groups that fought to create it.
title: The U.S. gets a new national marine sanctuary, the first led by a tribe

description: As climate change makes hurricanes stronger and more intense, island communities like Longboat Key are particularly susceptible to catastrophic damage from hurricanes. Residents say they are sticking around.
title: Come hurricane or high water, Florida island residents promise to stay

description: Craig Breedlove became the first person to drive faster than 500 miles per hour. But his record-breaking run almost ended in disaster.
title: 60 years ago, a jet-powered tricycle shattered the land speed record

description: Europa Clipper will make a six-year journey to Jupiter to study Europa, an icy-surfaced moon that scientists believe has “ingredients for life.”
title: A spacecraft headed to one of Jupiter's moons is set to launch

description: With only weeks to a divisive election it can be hard to talk politics. Polarization can damage our relationships and our health.  We have strategies to reduce election stress, starting with ourselves.
title: Are political disagreements stressing you out? Here are tips to bridge the divide

description: Bob Woodward speaks to NPR about the revelations in his new book, and recounts how key moments and meetings in recent years played out behind closed doors.
title: Bob Woodward takes NPR behind the headline-grabbing moments in his new book

description: Polls show that some Black men may be gravitating toward former President Trump or not vote at all. Vice President Harris and other prominent Democrats are trying to counter that.
title: In outreach to Black men, Harris to vow to legalize weed, protect crypto

description: The World Health Organization said a second dose will be crucial in order to stop the spread of the virus in Gaza and internationally.
title: To curb polio outbreak, children in Gaza are receiving a booster vaccine dose

description: Eden Alonso-Rivera of Grandville, Mich. is the high school winner of NPR's Student Podcast Challenge. Her winning entry, "A Relationship Behind Bars," is about her father's incarceration.
title: 'You're not alone:' A teen podcaster sends message to kids with incarcerated parents

description: Britain has closed it's last coal-fired power plant, making the country that pioneered coal power, the first to give it up in favor of cleaner options. We hear about the transition. And a small town in Wales has become the unlikely site of a world-renowned Elvis festival.
title: UK Ditches Coal Power, Embraces Elvis

description: Baba Siddique was close to several Bollywood superstars and known for throwing lavish parties.
title: Indian politician known for his close ties with Bollywood is killed in Mumbai
